newsitem.title: USA: NYCE cotton swings higher on close before data.
newsitem.headline: NYCE cotton swings higher on close before data.

text.p: NYCE cotton futures ended another lightly-traded session higher as prices climbed over unchanged on the close.

Trade was estimated at only 7,500 lots, as players await the U.S. Department of Agriculture's weekly export and sales report Thursday. Expectations are for continued strong sales as prices have remained relatively low.
The December contract ended up 0.22 at 72.95, having ranged narrowly from 73.00 to 72.13. The deferred months finished unchanged to 0.45 higher.
Technically, major resistance remained at 73.50 in December, where trade selling is likely to emerge, dealers said.
